title: WHY?!
body:
can someone please explain to me why Vayne can tumble through J4 ult?
like i understand champs who have abilties that can go through terrain, but Vayne's tumble cannot, so why can it go through J4's ult?

replies.body: because how else is vayne going to position herself to condemn j4 into his own ult?

It's actually because of the way it's coded. Almost all temporary walls are treated as clumped minioms. Vayne can tumble through minions so therefore she can tumble through j4's thin ult.

Edit: Temporary Walls.
Its because the walls so thin. Theres stuff more stupid than vaynes tumble. Like wukong can escape j4 ult if he decoys while standing right at the edge
Wait.... She can? Are you sure? O.o Maybe she tumbled during your jump and BEFORE the walls went down.
it just makes no sense at all....i think riot should fix this...makes me sad when im playing the prince :(
Because J4's wall is too thin, but really though I don't think she should have this privilege.

> [{quoted}](name=Periah,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=hc02PU2K,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-06-22T01:52:06.008+0000)
>
> can someone please explain to me why Vayne can tumble through J4 ult?
> like i understand champs who have abilties that can go through terrain, but Vayne's tumble cannot, so why can it go through J4's ult?

i think it' a game bug personally i never seen a vayne go through jarven' ult so can't really help you. =/
she does and has for a while
